alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laramie County through 230 PM MDT... At 157 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles east of Whitaker to 6 miles east of South Greeley to near Carr. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, South Greeley, Hillsdale, Ranchettes, North Cheyenne, Gun Barrel, Carpenter, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 362 and 402. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
